paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the TTR gene, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Patients aged 18–75 years, both sexes, with confirmed amyloid-positive biopsies.
patients.phenotype: TTR-FAP (Transthyretin familial amyloid polyneuropathy) Val30Met patients.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients with stage 1 TTR-FAP (able to walk without support) with autonomic or sensory–motor neuropathies were enrolled.
Patients from both sexes, aged 18–75 years, with confirmed amyloid-positive biopsies.

functional_data.summary: Tafamidis stabilizes TTR and reduces the progression of neuropathy.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in patients of Portuguese descent.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of early treatment with tafamidis.
key_quotes: Tafamidis proved effective in reducing the progress of neuropathy.
TTR stabilization was achieved in more than 90% of patients.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variants were extracted successfully.
